commit.message:
[BEAM-10310] Adding thread-safe restriction tracker wrapper.

Pretty self-explanatory. The wrapper was basic enough that I don't think it
makes sense to test it with unit tests. You'd basically just be unit testing
the mutex. Instead, I'm testing it in practice by replacing existing
restriction tracker usage with the thread-safe one.

nodes.bodyText: I'm a bit concerned with these lines here where one is accessing the internal Restrictions. They're being accessed outside of the lock's critical section. Should we have a Restriction() interface{} method to get the appropriate restriction in a thread safe manner?

commit.message:
[BEAM-10310] Adding GetRestriction method for RTrackers.

Also makes some fields in offsetrange.Tracker private, since they don't really
need to be public anymore.
